description:
I have re-processed the data collected by Steve and I and also added pooled data from imaging friends - additional luminance data from Steve's TEC image before we installed it at e-Eye (from his home observatory); RGB data from Ole Alexander and Ola Skarpen Ødegård using a Tak TOA150B - thank you to all of them for a joy in processing.  Each of us has produced images using variations of this data, and it is joy to see the different emphases each has made on this glorious target.  I am not sure of the total integration but certainly 50 hours plus.

From Ole's description:
"This is a picture made up of several observatories.The focus has been to get as deep as possible, I think we have managed to get it pretty good.
Imaging telescope or lens:TEC 140, Takahashi TOA150B
Imaging camera:QSI 690 wsg-, ZWO ASI6200MM Pro
Integration: more than 50 hours RGBL+HA
Data acquisition: Steve Milne & Barry Wilson, and Askvang Obsevatory Norway"

Processing: Barry Wilson.
Imaged between 23 Feb and 28 March.2020

The links to their magnificent images are:

Ole's: https://astrob.in/n00z79/0/
Steve's: https://astrob.in/rfqgua/0/
Ola's: https://astrob.in/n00z79/0/
title: Messier 51 The Whirpool Galaxy deep image with pooled data project
